title: Cancer Cases Are Rising Around the World
summary: Cancer is a serious disease that is affecting more and more people all over the world. Since 1990, the number of people getting cancer has more than doubled, reaching 18.5 million new cases in 2023. Sadly, about 10.4 million people die from cancer each year. Most of these cases and deaths happen in poorer countries. The good news is that many cancer deaths could be prevented. Over 40% of cancer deaths are linked to things we can change, like smoking, eating unhealthy foods, and having high blood sugar. By 2050, experts think cancer cases could rise to 30.5 million per year. To help, governments need to work on preventing cancer, finding it early, and making sure everyone can get treatment.

background_read: Cancer is a big health problem that affects many people. It happens when cells in the body grow too fast and can spread. Some cancers can be caused by things like smoking or bad eating habits. Doctors can treat cancer with medicine or surgery, but it's better to prevent it. This article talks about how cancer is increasing around the world, especially in places with less money. It explains that we can stop many cancer deaths by making healthy choices and helping everyone get care.
Article_Structure: WHO: People all over the world, especially in poorer countries, are affected by cancer.
WHAT: Cancer cases and deaths are rising, with many linked to preventable causes like smoking.
WHERE: This is happening globally, with most cases in low- and middle-income countries.
WHY: To reduce cancer, we need better prevention, early detection, and access to treatment.
